titlestmt.titleproper: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Printed Material, RG 8
A Guide to the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Printed Material, RG 8 FA1802

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 18:22:36 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation records, Printed Material, RG 8

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John S. and James L. Knight Foundation

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Record Group 8, Printed Material is divided into four series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 8 contains newsletters, articles, clippings, publications, and posters related to the work of the Knight Foundation. This series includes both internal and external communications created by the Knight Foundation as well as secondary sources that cover philanthropy, grants/grantees, and various programs and initiatives.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Material less than 10 years old is restricted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Knight Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

controlaccess.subject: Philanthropy
Charitable uses, trusts, and foundations -- United States

did.unittitle: Newsletters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The newsletters contain information about grant programs, officers, trustees, staff changes, the status of various initiatives, and interesting stories about Knight Foundation grants/grantees.

did.unittitle: Knight Foundation Newsletter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newsletter distributed to grantees and other interested parties; issued quarterly from October, 1989 until 1998 (Volumes 1-38). Includes features on grants awarded, initiatives, staff news, trustee news, and awards.

did.unittitle: Inside Knight Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Occasional newsletter written for advisors and committee members. Initiated 6/96, only volumes 1-2 were written. Articles include staff changes, committee changes, board member news, publications and meeting dates.

did.unittitle: Knight News (Employee Newsletter)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Knight News (employee newsletter) was created in February 1998 to inform employees regarding their benefits, current events, and issues of office life. Included are articles on Section 125 Spending Accounts, Dental Plan, Defined Contribution Plan, Health and Life Insurance, personal benefits statements, Book Club, Records Day, Corporate Run, Family Outing, Employee Assistance Plan (EAP), Education Assistance.

did.unittitle: Knight Foundation Newsletter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Newsletter distributed to grantees and other interested parties; issued quarterly from 1999 until Fall 2001 (Volumes 39-50). Includes features on grants awarded, initiatives, staff news, trustee news, and awards.

did.unittitle: News@Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News@Knight, quarterly publication of the Knight Foundation, is aimed at grantees and other interested parties. Starting with Issue No. 51, the Knight Foundation Newsletter had a new look and name. More space was devoted to developments in Journalism Initiatives and Community Partners programs. Box 2 contains Issues 51-58.

did.unittitle: News@Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: News@Knight, quarterly publication of the Knight Foundation, is aimed at grantees and other interested parties. Box 3 starts with Issue No. 59, Winter 2004. The last issue published was No. 68, Spring/Summer 2006.

did.unittitle: Working@Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Working@Knight is an electronic newsletter sent to Knight Foundation Advisers and other interested parties to keep them informed of notable grants and Knight Foundation news. The file contains printed versions of the e-newletter, printed on a monthly basis.

did.unittitle: KnightNews (monthly e-newsletter)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: KnightNews is a monthly e-newsletter update on the "experimentation and innovation underway at Knight Foundation."

did.unittitle: Knight Arts Update

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The newsletter, published weekly only on the Knight Arts Blog, provides updates on the South Florida Arts community. There are gaps in this collection from June 2011 to June 2013. Also starting in 2013, the blog featured arts across all of KF's communities. (4 folders)

did.unittitle: Community Information Needs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The newsletter, published only online at www.informationneeds.org serves to inform the public on resources available to Communities as part of the Community Information Needs project. One issue (1/13/2010) lists the winners of the second Knight Community Information Challenge.

did.unittitle: Knight News - Trustees Edition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Monthly e-newsletter, published online for KF trustees, provides information on KF staff, grants, awards, and current news. Starting in November 2010, the online addition was supplemented with a printed abstract for distribution to trustees.

did.unittitle: Comms Weekly

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Announcement of a new e-newsletter, Comms Weekly, distributed to KF staff by Andrew Sherry, VP of Communications. Email presents events coming up with a communications component, as well as a snapshot of press highlights and social media performance from the week before. Some weeks, information on the launching of the new initiative, Knight News Challenge: Health, are included. That challenge is being led by Matt Haggman and John Bracken. The September 16, 2013 issue includes information on the Detroit Knight Arts Challenge Awards. Also included is the announcement of the opening of the Perez Art Museum, which includes a John S. and James L. Knight Plaza. Starting in July 2016, Comms Weekly changed formats and title to Comms Monthly which was published once a month. 5 folders

did.unittitle: Fluxx Quarterly Update

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Announcement of a new e-newsletter, Fluxx Quarterly Update, and a copy of the third quarter update. The updates are intended to inform staff about improvements being made to KF's Fluxx Grants Management System. Also included is a 1st quarter 2014 Update and updates in the form of memos to staff re: new grant form and grantee portal in 2016.

did.unittitle: Knight's Media Innovation Newsletter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Announcement of a new e-newsletter, Knight's Media Innovation Newsletter (called simply Media Innovation Newsletter by January 2016). This will be a monthly newsletter produced by the Media Innovation team to share what's happening in their world, shine a light on alumni and current grantees, and inform about media and tech events around the country.

did.unittitle: Knight Enterprise Fund Update

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Announcement of a new e-newsletter, Knight Enterprise Fund Update, a bi-weekly memo to staff featuring portfolio news, job opportunities at start-ups, additions to the funds, and other news of note.

did.unittitle: @KnightFdn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Announcement of a new e-newsletter, @KnightFdn, which consists of Tweet-length entries linked back to KnightBlog. Also included is an issue of the e-newsletter. Following a gap of almost two years, "issues" beginning in the summer of 2013 have a new appearance.

did.unittitle: Articles and Clippings
Clara I. Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Number of clippings, mostly from the Akron Beacon Journal, pertaining to Clara Knight, the mother of John and James Knight, and a contributor to the Knight Foundation. The articles refer to her clubs and activities, her family life and background, and her sons and grandsons.

did.unittitle: "Publisher John S. Knight: The New Breed" - Newsweek cover story

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issue features a portrait of John S. Knight on the cover. Provides background information and features interviews with Knight newsmen. Also mentioned are James L. Knight and Lee Hills. 2 original issues and a color copy.

did.unittitle: Article on Knight Foundation Student Loans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Knight Foundation to Aid 11 Students" article from 1959. Publication unknown.

did.unittitle: Article on Knight Foundation Student Loans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Six Area Students Win Knight Foundation Loans" article from Akron Beacon Journal, 7/22/63.

did.unittitle: Article on Knight Foundation Student Loans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "7 Win Knight Scholarships" article from Akron Beacon Journal, 7/1/64.

did.unittitle: Article on Knight Foundation Student Loans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "8 in Area Get Knight Awards" article in Akron Beacon Journal on 8/4/65.

did.unittitle: Article on Knight Foundation Student Loans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Five Given Knight Foundation Grants" article in Akron Beacon Journal, 6/22/66.

did.unittitle: Article on Grant to Akron Public Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles from Akron Beacon Journal: "New Downtown Park is Knight Foundation Gift," and "Knight Foundation Park Gift Makes Everybody Happy."

did.unittitle: Article on Grant for Public Park in Akron

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article from Akron Beacon Journal: "Library Trustees Cut Back Proposal for 'People Park.'"

did.unittitle: "Beryl Knight Leaves $1.9 Million Estate"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article on Beryl Knight Estate, designating KF to take control of interests not included in the estate, has no date (probably Akron-Beacon Journal). Mrs. Beryl Knight died on 8/8/1974.

did.unittitle: Article on James L. Knight and Knight Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miami Herald article, "Knight elected by foundation; grants awarded" re: Knight's election as chairman of the Knight Foundation, succeeding his brother.

did.unittitle: Articles on John S. Knight's estate and memorial, Journalism Program at Stanford

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles on the taxes paid by the estate of John S. Knight, a memorial service for John S. Knight, and the John S. Knight Fellowship Program at Stanford University.

did.unittitle: Article on John S. Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal article: "Conference Room Dedicated in Miami: Remembering One Man's Indelible Impact."

did.unittitle: Article on John S. Knight Fellowships for Professional Journalism at Stanford University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: California Publisher article on John S. Knight Fellowships for Professional Journalism at Stanford University: "New Name for Fellowships."

did.unittitle: Article on James Knight receiving honorary degree from University of Florida

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article from University of Florida's Communigator on honorary degree given to James L. Knight.

did.unittitle: Articles on James Knight, grant to University of North Carolina, and death of Mary Ann Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles on an award to James L. Knight, a grant to the University of North Carolina School of Journalism, and the death of James's wife, Mary Ann Knight.

did.unittitle: News clipping re: John S. Knight Estate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: New York Times article (4/21/1985) titled, "Knight Estate to Leave Millions to Foundation." Part of article is cut off.

did.unittitle: Article on new trustees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal article: "New Trustees for Knight Foundation"

did.unittitle: Article on Knight Foundation in "Knight-Ridder News"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Spring, 1987 issue of Knight-Ridder News contains articles "The Knight Foundation Reaches out to Your Community," and "Knight Foundation Grants at Work." Includes color photographs of the trustees and grantees.

did.unittitle: Book Review: Charles Whited's biography of John S. Knight

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reviews of Charles Whited's biography of John S. Knight, "Knight: A Publisher in the Tumultuous Century" by the New York Times Book Review and the Akron Beacon Journal.

did.unittitle: "Knight Foundation Uses New Wealth from Bequest to Help Liberal Arts Colleges"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article in the Chronicle of Higher Education titled, "Knight Foundation Uses New Wealth from Bequest to Help Selected Independent Liberal Arts Colleges."

did.unittitle: "Newspapers and Literacy:...'that all may read'" - American Newspaper Publishers Association

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reference publication on literacy by the American Newspaper Publishers Association (ANPA), "Newspapers and Literacy: . . . that all may read" Published 7/89, Knight Foundation is listed on page 24, under "Literacy Funding by Major National Newspaper Organizations."

did.unittitle: Foundation Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various articles from an unidentified publication about the value of foundation archives.

did.unittitle: News clipping re: James L. Knight Estate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Unidentified newspaper article (1991) titled, " Foundation to get the bulk of Knight stock."

did.unittitle: Articles on Kids Voting Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles from USA Today, The Bradenton Herald, and the Charlotte Observer on the Kids Voting program.

did.unittitle: The Miami Herald - Hurricane Andrew coverage

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issues of The Miami Herald newspaper featuring the devastation of Hurricane Andrew and its aftermath. Thirteen issues of the newspaper are included (Folders 1 - 13). Some contain the entire newspaper. Later on, only the first (news) section was saved. Some issues have had articles clipped from them.

did.unittitle: Chronicle of Philanthropy article: "Bold Knight? Foundation Aims to Shed Obscurity"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reprint of an article from the Chronicle of Philanthropy: "Bold Knight? Foundation Aims to Shed Obscurity." Includes an interview and photograph of Creed Black.

did.unittitle: Article on a campaign for the Kenan Institute

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article from the Raleigh, NC News and Observer: "Kenan Institute Reaches into Southeast Asia." The article mentions that Creed Black of the Knight Foundation spoke at the campaign for the Kenan Institute.

did.unittitle: Article on various grants, the Knight Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics, etc., 1995

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles on Lee Hills Hall, the John S. Knight Fellowships at Stanford University, the Oregon Symphony, Knight Scholars at Florida A&M University, Florida Philharmonic, Gallaudet University, Kettering Foundation's Project on Public Life and the Press, the Blue Grass Foundation, and the Knight Commission on Intercollegiate Athletics.

did.unittitle: American News: Aberdeen Special Edition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reprint of a five-part series, Charting Change, which presents an in-depth look at the evolution of the Dakota Midland and what is needed to survive, adapt and thrive in the future.

did.unittitle: The Charlotte Observer - In-depth Look at the Charlotte Region

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reprint of a four part series on Charlotte, North Carolina which looks at leadership, growth, workforce and neighborhoods.

did.unittitle: Article on KF grant to Capital Cultural Center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article from the Tallahassee Democrat about the Capital Cultural Center: "Arts Center Shapes Up, Name by Name: The Knight Foundation is Keeping the Ball Rolling with a $1 Million Pledge."

did.unittitle: Articles on Journalism Education, Fellowship Recipients and the Knight Commission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article from the Chronicle of Higher Education: "Knight Foundation Uses Grants to Improve Journalism Education." Article from New York Times: "More Than 50 Journalists are Fellowship Recipients." Article from USA Today: "Winning One for the Admissions Office."

did.unittitle: The Kansas City Star: Money Games Inside the NCAA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reprint of a six-part series of articles examining NCAA problems and some possible solutions. The Knight Commission on ICA is mentioned.

did.unittitle: The New York Times - Grand Forks, N.D.: After Flooding, After Fire, Salvaging a Cultural Life

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article on rebuilding of Grand Forks, North Dakota after devastating fire and floods emphasizes the role of cultural institutions. A Knight Foundation grant to the North Valley Arts Council is mentioned.

did.unittitle: Grand Forks Herald - River Cities Rising: One Year after the Flood

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Special section commemorates the devastating floods and fires that ravaged Grand Forks, North Dakoka in April 1997.

did.unittitle: 50th Anniversary of Knight Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles in the Akron Beacon Journal and The Miami Herald reporting on the 50th anniversary year celebrations of KF and the community grants made in Akron and Miami in its honor. Hodding Carter, Bud Meyer, Gerald Austen, and Penny McPhee are mentioned. Also included is an article in Editor & Publisher magazine about KF's and the Knight Brothers' gifts to journalism education and causes, "The Helping Hands of Journalism" and a KF ad highlighting its 50th year (3 copies). NOTE: The Akron Beacon Journal article is missing page 1.

did.unittitle: The New York Times - U.S. Attacked

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Issue of The New York Times reporting on the destruction of the World Trade Center towers and the attack on the Pentagon.

did.unittitle: "With RFK in the Delta" by John Carr

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This article in the April/May issue of American Heritage magazine was written by journalist John Carr, reporter for the Delta Democrat-Times in 1967 when Hodding Carter was editor and associate publisher. Carter's connection to the visit of Robert F. Kennedy to the delta country in 1967 is mentioned.

did.unittitle: "Knight Foundation invests more than $2.28 million in Charlotte region in 2001"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article appeared in the Spring 2002 Foundation for the Carolinas' Connections Newsletter. It described the new Community Partners program and quoted Knight liaison, Susan Patterson.

did.unittitle: "Knight Foundation Awards Knight Center $2.2 Million"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article appeared in the Spring 2005 EJ: A magazine of the Knight Center for Environmental Journalism at Michigan State University. Page 8. The grant, which is the largest in the history if the School of Journalism at MSU, will enable the Knight Center to dramatically expand its programs.

did.unittitle: Sun Herald Special -"The first 100 Days after Hurricane Katrina"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Special section commemorates the devastating hurricane and flooding which destroyed the Gulf Coast of Mississippi and Louisiana in 2005 and emphasizes the rebuilding efforts. (2 copies)

did.unittitle: "Outsourcing: Where Missions Meet"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article, which appeared in CFQ (Commonfund Quarterly) (Fall 2005/Winter 2006) asked the question, "Should your nonprofit outsource some or all of its investment management function?". KF Trustee, John Rogers, Jr. is quoted in the article explaining KF's reasons for outsourcing its investment management function.

did.unittitle: "New Executives Put Themselves on Macon's Map"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article appeared in November/December 2005 issue of Address Macon and features Beverly Blake, Community Liaison Program Officer for Georgia. The article mentions her work with the Macon community and KF president, Alberto Ibarguen. Also included in a photo with Blake is Macon resident and KF trustee Beverly Knight Olson. (2 copies)

did.unittitle: "Beacon Journal Facing Loss of Identity"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article copied from the Plain Dealer website. Article, which speculates on the possible sale of the Akron Beacon Journal, mentions KF trustee James Crutchfield and John S. Knight. Also included is a timeline of ABJ from its purchase in 1903 by CL Knight.

did.unittitle: News coverage of First Amendment Survey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Selected articles and clippings on KF's survey of American High School students and the First Amendment.

did.unittitle: A Tale of Two Cities and the Day They Collided: Miami Noir

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Columbia Journalism Review article (Jan/Feb 2006 issue) by Tom Austin about the fallout from the suicide of Miami commissioner Art Teele in the lobby of the Miami Herald. Mentioned in the article is the Knight Foundation, Alvah Chapman, Hodding Carter, Alberto Ibarguen and Rod Petrey.

did.unittitle: Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Five clippings: 1) Symphony magazine, May-June 2007 "The Knight's Roundtable: Insider reflections on the decade-long Magic of Music Initiative and its impact on the orchestra world." 2) New York Times: May 10, 2007 - "Telling Bogus From True: A Class in Reading News" about KF-sponsored program at SUNY - Stony Brook. Eric Newton is quoted in article. 3) Georgia Informer: "Housing Made Affordable in the City of Macon", September, 2007 re: redevelopment of Beall's Hill with help of a grant from the Knight Foundation. Beverly Blake is mentioned. 4) Miami Herald: "Killers stalk Latin American journalists with impunity", October 15, 2007 re: a Knight Foundation grant to IAPA's impunity project to extend the project. Alberto Ibarguen is mentioned. 5) The Dell & Cannon; A Ransom Everglades School Publication, "Breakthrough receives $3.25 million from Knight Foundation to Expand in Miami", December 2007 re: Knight Foundation grant to Breakthrough Miami to extend its academic enrichment and advancement program for middle and high school students in Miami. Alberto Ibarguen is mentioned.

did.unittitle: Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes news articles on a Knight Foundation grant to Duluth to support sustainable economic and social growth; a $1.05 million grant for Habitat for Humanity of the Mississippi Gulf Coast; the opening of the Newseum in Washington, DC; an interview with Trabian Shorters re: social entrepreneurship; an editorial re: a OneCommunity grant for Milledgeville; the Knight Commission on the Information Needs of Communities in a Democracy; and the establishment of the BioInnovation Institute in Akron, Ohio with help from a $20 million grant from KF. Also included are Knight News Challenge Media Clips, which includes blogs.

did.unittitle: Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles and blogs downloaded from the KF Intranet: Office Chatter. Includes an article about a KF grantee, Spot.US; a speech by Paula Ellis; a blog entry concerning foundation-supported journalism; articles re: city of Milledgeville winning a grant from KF for digital upgrades and censorship at Google; the Knight Arts blog; a story on the debut of "Final Edition: Journalism According to Jack and Jim Knight", a documentary on the Knight brothers; and an article (in Spanish) re: Knight Foundation grants with the Knight Arts Challenge in Miami for $3.7 million. Dennis Scholl is quoted in the article.

did.unittitle: Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Full page ad in Biloxi Sun Herald re: rebuilding of gulf communities after Hurricane Katrina and featuring a photo of KF staff and trustees volunteering with Habitat for Humanity; ads re: Knight Arts Challenges in Miami and Philadelphia; article in Pulse about Knight's support of cutting edge artists in Miami and a small article in the newsletter of Art Basel, the Miami Beach arts festival, features the Knight Arts Challenge and a picture of Alberto Ibarguen. KF announced the 2010 winners at Art Basel.

did.unittitle: Articles and Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles and blogs downloaded from the KF Intranet. Includes a New York Times article on Random Acts of Culture program supported by KF; and an article, "Glass Half Full" re: 2011 Knight Open Government survey finds freedom of information change but many agencies lag in following Obama's openness order; Miami Herald article re: Artistic Explosion in Miami re: KF's private/public partnership and the Knight Arts Challenge. Also included are ads re: Journalism and Media Grant Making publication, and ads re: Knight Arts Challenges in Miami and Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: Random Acts of Culture

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Article in Philanthropy magazine about the Knight Foundation and its art program, Random Acts of Culture. Features information about the Knight brothers (with photographs) and the Knight Foundation. Dennis Scholl is interviewed. (2 copies of magazine)

did.unittitle: Articles and Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: USA Today Snapshot: "Most Important First Amendment Right". The source was the KF survey of students and teachers.

did.unittitle: My Year with Knight by Brian Brackeen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blog post from The Starting Gate details how KF has impacted Brian Brackeen's start-up company, Kairos.

did.unittitle: Articles and Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Articles re: Online platform "Open Humans"; Twitter; Take-Action Buttons; and Growing a Non-Profit News Site.

did.unittitle: Miami Today: Best of Miami 2015

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miami Today special issue features KF Trustee Susan Kronick, Dennis Scholl and Victoria Rogers for their work with the arts; Miami Program Director, Matt Haggman, for improving the quality of life in Miami; and Lilly Weinberg as an "unsung hero". (2 copies).

did.unittitle: Matt Haggman: Building Miami Entrepreneurs at Knight Foundation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Miami Today cover story featuring Miami Program Director, Matt Haggman (2 copies).

did.unittitle: Have Museum - Will Travel: Bringing Artwork to the People

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Chronicle of Philanthropy article on the KF sponsored Inside Out art program in Detroit which places replicas of master artworks outdoors. The article mentions a $2 million KF grant to bring the program to Miami, Philadelphia and Akron.

did.unittitle: Theaster Gates Takes Art to the Bank

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chicago Reader cover story about KF grantee, Theaster Gates, and a project of his Rebuild Foundation, which turned an old bank building into public art spaces.

did.unittitle: John Shively Knight, 1894-1981: A Tribute to an American editor by the Akron Beacon Journal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal memorial booklet published June 1981 in tribute to John S. Knight. Contains photos, biographical information on Knight and his family, tributes by leaders of the Akron business community and newspaper industry and readers, details on the Knight Foundation, honors and awards received by Knight, and his memorial service. (2 copies, plus 4 reprints).

did.unittitle: Wheels of Fortune: A History of Rubber in Akron - Who Runs Akron? A New Style of Leadership

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal produced a yearlong look at the rise and fall of Akron's rubber industry. Week 48 focused on the tire company executives and the Beacon Journal's John S. Knight who were "Akron's primary movers and shakers during the industry's heyday." Also included is an article on the level of Knight Foundation giving to Akron. Quoted are: John Ong, Gerald Austen, C.C. Gibson, and Ben Maidenburg. (2 copies)

did.unittitle: Akron Beacon Journal - "John S. Knight is Dead at 86"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal front page obituary of John S. Knight, who died June 16, 1981 at the age of 86.

did.unittitle: Slow Growth at the Biggest Foundations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Chronicle of Philanthropy article on foundations features a picture and caption of KF president, Alberto Ibarguen, in Biloxi after Hurricane Katrina. Ibarguen is quoted in the article and KF's relief efforts described.

did.unittitle: Akron Beacon Journal - "Proud Past, New Dawn"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal special section about its legacy and history of 100 years under the Knight name. The McClatchy chain, which bought Knight Ridder in 2006, sold the paper in June 2006. Included in the special section is an article on the influence of John S. Knight and a historical timeline.

did.unittitle: How Detroit Was Reborn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sunday Detroit Free Press newspapers (2 copies) with multiple stories about Detroit's rise from bankruptcy and the Grand Bargain engineered, in part, by the Knight Foundation and trustee Mariam Noland. Also included is a note to Alberto Ibarguen from Paul Anger, Editor of the Press.

did.unittitle: 50th Anniversary of Knight Foundation Commemorative Articles and Ads

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Akron Beacon Journal special section about The Knight Foundation at 50, which includes a history of the Foundation and the Knight brothers and highlights of grants made. Also included are full page ads in the Miami Herald and the Sun-Sentinel of South Florida on the occasion of KF's anniversary.

did.unittitle: Publications
Hurricane Andrew: The Big One

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Soft cover book, "Hurricane Andrew: The Big One." Photographs by the staffs of the Miami Herald and El Nuevo Herald, 1992. Some of the photographs in this book were used in the 1992 Annual Report.

did.unittitle: Arts Funding: A Report on Foundation and Corporate Grantmaking Trends and Arts Funding Revisited

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Soft cover book, Arts Funding: A Report on Foundation and Corporate Grantmaking Trends (1993) and Arts Funding Revisited (updated, 1995). A comprehensive study of grantmaking trends, it was based on research conducted by the Foundation Center with support and collaboration of Grantmakers in the Arts. The Knight Foundation was one of the foundations participating in the research study. Also included is an update to the report and highlights.

did.unittitle: The Decay of America's Cities: A Call for Leadership

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Soft cover book, The Decay of America's Cities: A Call for Leadership, was published by the American Press Institute. It is the edited proceedings of the J. Montgomery Curtis Memorial Seminar. The Seminar is supported by endowment funds provided by the Knight Foundation. KF Trustee, James Batten, was a featured speaker. The book includes photos, biographical information and the text of his speech.

did.unittitle: Lessons Learned from Hurricane Andrew

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conference proceedings. The conference was sponsored by a grant from the Knight Foundation.

did.unittitle: Redland: A Preservation and Tourism Plan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published by the Metropolitan Dade County Office of Community Development Historic Preservation Division and the University of Miami School of Architecture with a grant from the Knight Foundation. The Redland is an agricultural area of South Dade County and was hard hit by Hurrican Andrew.

did.unittitle: Community Foundations in the United States: 1992 Status

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Soft cover book, "Community Foundations in the United States: 1992 Status", prepared by the Council on Foundations from survey data.

did.unittitle: The Governor's Forum: Engaging in a Civil Society: Report and Recommendations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Engaging in a Civil Society" is a report and recommendations from a statewide conference on building strong partnerships of government, business and the nonprofit sector to address Florida's needs in the 21st century. Hodding Carter, Penny McPhee and Larry Meyer participated.

did.unittitle: Arts Survive: A Study of Sustainability in Arts Education Partnerships

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Soft cover book, Arts Survive: A Study of Sustainability in Arts Education Partnerships by Steve Seidel, Meredith Eppel, Maria Martiniello of Project Zero, Harvard Graduate School of Education. The Arts Survive Research Study was supported by the Knight Foundation. (3 copies)

did.unittitle: American Journalism in Transition: A View at the Top

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: American Journalism in Transition: A View at the Top. A Report of the Fifth Annual Aspen Institute Conference on Journalism and Society by Amy Korzick Garmer. This is a summary of the conference, which featured Hodding Carter as speaker and participant. The conference was sponsored by the Knight Foundation.

did.unittitle: Covering the Education Beat: A Current Guide for Editors, Writers and the Public

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note-book publication (binder cover removed), Covering the Education Beat: A Current Guide for Editors, Writers and the Public. Prepared by the National Education Writers Association, this resource guide provides advice, source material, and background materials. The guide was produced with funds from the Knight Foundation.

did.unittitle: Plugged In: Using the Internet for High School (and Professional) Journalism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Distributed by the Radio and Television News Directors Foundation and supported by KF.

did.unittitle: Evaluating Community Collaborations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hardback book, Evaluating Community Collaborations, edited by Thomas Backer. The book is the "first comprehensive treatment of theoretical, research and practice issues concerning the evaluation of collaborations." It includes a chapter on the Knight Foundation's Youth Violence Initiative authored by Knight consultant Nancy Guerra and commentary by John Bare.

did.unittitle: Journalism, Security, and the Public Interest: Best Practices for Reporting in Unpredictable Times

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. A report of the Seventh Annual Aspen Institute Conference on Journalism and Society. It features a forward prepared by Eric Newton. Newton and Alberto Ibarguen participated in the conference, which was partially supported by KF and put on by The Aspen Institute.

did.unittitle: Philanthropy in the Sunshine State

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover booklet prepared by the Florida Philanthropic Network, which presents a comprehensive look at Florida's grantmaking foundations and donors. Includes information on KF, ranked number 1 in assets in the state of Florida. Hodding Carter served on its board of directors.

did.unittitle: Plugged In: Using the Internet for High School (and Professional) Journalism; Second Edition

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Distributed by the Radio and Television News Directors Foundation and supported by KF. Updated version of the 2002 book.

did.unittitle: Digital Future Initiative: Challenges and Opportunities for Public Service Media in the Digital Age

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. A report by the DFI panel, of which Alberto Ibarguen served as an ex officio member.

did.unittitle: Overtown: Men's Health Study

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. A report by the Collins Center for Public Policy and partially funded by KF. The report detailed the results of a study of men's health in the Overtown section of Miami, FL.

did.unittitle: Risk Map for Journalists: Brazil - Colombia - Mexico by IAPA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book prepared by the Inter American Press Association with support by the Knight Foundation. Knight Foundation's support (over 4 million dollars since 1997) is mentioned, as are significant KF personnel. The publication serves to document the violence against journalists in the three countries and alerts and educates journalists on the dangers inherent to news coverage in those countries.

did.unittitle: A Platform for Participation and Innovation: Smart Communities in Chicago Master Plan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By LISC/Chicago. The master plan is part of the City's Digital Excellence Initiative aimed at demonstrating the value of technology to those who don't currently use it, improving access to technology tools and helping to create a 21st century digital infrastructure citywide.

did.unittitle: Austen BioInnovation Institute in Akron

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brochure describing the Institute, which was named for retired chairman, Gerald Austen, and supported by KF (3 copies).

did.unittitle: Seeking Sustainability: A Nonprofit News Roundtable: Summary & Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report came out of a roundtable discussion, hosted by KF, and featuring several KF speakers, on how non-profit journalism programs can move beyond the support of foundations and wealthy individuals and find sustainability.

did.unittitle: Media, Information Systems and Communities: Lessons from Haiti

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report came out of a roundtable discussion, hosted by KF, and discusses how new applications, such as SMS (short message service), texting, interactive online maps and radio-cell phone hybrids, were used to aid disaster recovery operations. Also includes a copy of the report translated into French and also into Creole.

did.unittitle: What's Next for Philanthropy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. A report by the Monitor Institute. Acting Bigger and adapting better in a networked world. Co-authored by Barbara Kibbe, a featured speaker at a KF staff retreat. Mayur Patel is listed as a contributor. (3 copies)

did.unittitle: Center for Investigative Reporting: California Watch Year One Evaluation: Executive Summary

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. California Watch produces investigative and enterprise stories that are distributed to news partners across all platforms. It is supported by KF. (3 copies)

did.unittitle: American Public Media's Public Insight Journalism Year One Evaluation Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Public Insight Journalism is a new model of journalism designed to bring together public engagement, the knowledge-sharing power of the internet, and high journalistic standards. It is supported by KF. The report was prepared by the LFA group. (2 copies)

did.unittitle: City Success: Theories of Urban Prosperity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Choosing the right path to success is one of the most important decisions urban leaders will make. City Success is a comprehensive review of the principal theories of urban success divided into three categories: Theories of Firms, Theories of People, and Theories of Place by Joseph Cortright, Impresa Consulting and supported by CEOs for Cities and KF.

did.unittitle: National Public Radio: Knight Training Evaluation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. TCC group was hired to measure the direct impact of NPR's Knight Training Program on newsroom operations, determine what worked, and identify best practices. (2 copies)

did.unittitle: Evaluation of the Knight Case Studies Initiative

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. The Knight Case Studies Initiative was launched in February 2007 to enhance the way journalism is taught by applying the Case Method of instruction to the field of journalism. KF hired metis associates to produce an evaluation of the project. (2 copies)

did.unittitle: Jefferson Institute's Military Archives Project in Serbia: From Ruins of War, a Nation's History Pre

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reporter's analysis by Joan McQueeney Mitric and Djordje Padejski, details the results of a $50,000 seed money grant from KF to the Jefferson Institute to design a system to convert the Yugoslavian military's 40 million paper documents into searchable, digital format.

did.unittitle: Connected Citizens: The Power, Peril and Potential of Networks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Forward written by KF which asked the Monitor Institute to take a critical look at the role of networks in community life. The resulting essay was written by Diana Scearce.

did.unittitle: Mississippi Renewal Forum Rebuilding Efforts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Four publications: 1) Summary Report: Recommendations for Rebuilding the Gulf Coast; 2) A Pattern Bok for Gulf Coast Neighborhoods: Details and techniques for building and renovating Gulf Coast houses. KF grants have supported this rebuilding process, particularly in Biloxi, MS. 3) New York Times Magazine article (May 21, 2006), "Battle for Biloxi" critical of the rebuilding efforts. KF is mentioned. 4) "Rebuilding the Gulf Coast: Mississippi Renewal Forum: October 12-17, 2005: schedule and articles of interest on participants.

did.unittitle: One Laptop Per Child Association Newsletter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Features article, "Principal Walker's Reaction to OLPC at Miami Holmes Elementary School," about KF grant to a Miami elementary school. Article includes a photograph of George Martinez, Alberto Ibarguen, and former KF trustee Dave Lawrence. KF was listed as an OLPC institutional partner.

did.unittitle: The Pulitzer Prize Photographs: Capture the Moment

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Featuring Pulitzer prize winning news photos from 1942-2011. Eric Newton edited the book. A traveling exhibit of the photos, supported by KF, was on display at the Frost Museum, FIU in 2014.

did.unittitle: Evaluation of the Ashoka News and Knowledge Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover books. Three reports produced by LFA Group: Evaluation of the Ashoka News & Knowledge Program, Final Report; Ashoka News & Knowledge Program, Fellow Snapshots; and Case Studies of Four Ashoka Fellows.

did.unittitle: A Report on the Carnegie-Knight Initiative on the Future of Journalism Education

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. The Carnegie-Knight initiative was developed to "advance the US news business by helping revitalize schools of journalism" through curriculum enrichment, News21, and the Carnegie-Knight Task Force. This book reports on the initiative and its outcomes at eleven journalism schools.

did.unittitle: Great Expectations: Macon Speaks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. A report by the Fanning Institute. KF provided partial support for a public engagement survey of Macon, Georgia residents. Focus groups and neighborhood meeting participants voiced their concerns and priorities in anticipation of the upcoming local elections.

did.unittitle: Conducting a Scan of Your College Access and Success System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover book. Why it matters. How to do it. How to use it. By Victoria Dougherty and Michele Lempa of the OMG Center for Collaborative Learning. The case study research, conducted in Miami and Philadelphia, was funded by KF. 3 copies

did.unittitle: 2012 BME Leadership Award Winners: Share, Inspire, Empower

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover booklet presents the winners of the Black Male Engagement (BME) challenge in Detroit and Philadelphia. Each winner has a brief profile, photo, project description, and contact information. 6 copies

did.unittitle: 2013 BME Leadership Award Winners: Share, Inspire, Empower

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Softcover booklet presents the winners of the Black Male Engagement (BME) challenge in Detroit, Baltimore and Philadelphia. Each winner has a brief profile, photo, project description, and contact information. 3 copies

did.unittitle: Perez Art Museum Miami (PAMM)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The former Miami Art Museum, now the Perez Art Museum Miami opened its new waterfront facility in December 2013. It features a Knight Plaza which will link PAMM to the Frost Museum of Science and a Knight Education Center, designed to support innovative education programs. Included are brochures for PAMM and the Knight Schools Program; and two photos of the plaza with a note from Alberto Ibarguen to trustees and staff (and replies from Paul Steiger and Frank Borges).

did.unittitle: FIU Foundation 2012-2013 Annual Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Florida International University Foundation Annual Report features a story about KF's commitment to the school and a photo of Alberto Ibarguen posing with the alumni of the school on the staff.

did.unittitle: Clusters and Your Economy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Illustrated booklet, whose printing costs were subsidized by KF, about the concept of economic clustering.

did.unittitle: Beyond the Fourth Estate

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "The $2.4 billion Knight Foundation is expanding on its journalistic roots to delve into new areas of community giving." Article reprinted from Private Wealth Magazine features interviews with Alberto Ibarguen, Andrew Sherry, and Ben Wirz. The legacy of Jack Knight is featured. (6 copies)

did.unittitle: The Untold Story of American Non-Voters: A Knight Foundation Study
Miscellaneous
Silver Knight Award 50th Anniversary Poster

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Signed by artist Xavier Cortada.

did.unittitle: 2010 The Black Book: PODER

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oversize booklet featuring short segments on prominent Hispanics. Alberto Ibarguen is one of the featured people. Includes photographs taken at KF office.

did.unittitle: Proclamation: Knight Arts Challenge Day

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Proclamation, issued by Philadelphia, PA mayor Michael Nutter proclaiming April 23, 2012 as Knight Arts Challenge Day. KF announced the Challenge grant recipients on that day.

did.unittitle: Seriagraphs presented to Knight Foundation from the Campaign for the Visual Arts, Charlotte, NC

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Limited edition of 8 seriagraphs on the theme "Out of Context" organized by CONTEXT Visual Arts Center and procured by the Campaign for Visual Arts in Center City Charlotte (North Carolina). Presented to the Knight Foundation in appreciation of its contribution to the campaign. (In box)

did.unittitle: Knight Foundation Time Line

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seven copies of a Knight Foundation time line produced to commemorate the 50th anniversary of its founding. Contains photographs, and a "History at a Glance" (oversize; some copies are proofs).

did.unittitle: "You're the Tops!" Sketch, International Museum of Cartoon Art

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Limited edition (19/100) sketch by artist Jules Feiffer presented to Knight Foundation at "You're the Tops!", A Tribute to Major Donors, Friday, March 8, 1996, International Museum of Cartoon Art.

did.unittitle: Knight News Challenge Posters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rolled posters two each announcing 2006 contest (orange) and 2007 contest (blue). Stored with oversize boxes.

did.unittitle: Knight Foundation Poster/Backdrop

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oversized, rolled poster (blue and white) stored above work station. Motto is "Writing the Story of Transformation" (superceded).
